intro: Alsine striata, commonly known as narrowleaf sandparsley, is a flowering plant belonging to the Apiaceae family. It is characterized by its slender, often hairy stems and small, compound leaves that are typically arranged in a basal rosette. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers arranged in umbels, which are typical of the carrot family. It is often found in sandy or gravelly soils in arid or semi-arid regions. Alsine striata is adapted to thrive in harsh environments, making it a common sight in desert and coastal areas.
